question.title: Mapping yaml to a class in a imported project
question.body:
I have a project, that contains a class of data , and functionality to operate on that data.

I have another project, that will import that class and the functionality to operate on that data. This project will contain a YAML file.

So far I have worked on projects, where the yaml file and class are in the same project. But in this case in project A i want


@Configuration
@EnableConfigurationProperties
//@ConfigurationProperties(prefix = "data")
@ConfigurationProperties
public class DataModel {
    
    private String journey;
    private List<Endpoint> endpoints = new ArrayList<Endpoint>();

    

    public String getJourney() {
        return journey;
    }

    public void setJourney(String journey) {
        this.journey = journey;
    }

    public List<Endpoint> getEndpoints() {
        return endpoints;
    }

    public void setEndpoints(List<Endpoint> endpoints) {
        this.endpoints = endpoints;
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "DataModel [journey=" + journey + "]";
    }
}

@Service
public class DataService {
    
    @Autowired
    private DataModel datamodel;

     
    public void PrintData() {
        System.out.println(datamodel.getJourney());
        for(Endpoint endpoint: datamodel.getEndpoints()) {
            System.out.println(endpoint.toString());
        }
    }
}

And in project B I have the yaml file.

---
journey: journey1
endpoints: 
    - 
      endpointURL: endpoint1
      payload:   xml
      additionalPath: GET
    - 
      endpointURL: endpoint2
      payload:   json
      additionalPath: PUT
    - 
      endpointURL: endpoint3
      payload:   json
      additionalPath: POST

Next week, I will try this , but I just want to check, this should work. You can use a YAML file to populate an imported class.
